fr.lipn.nlptools.uima.common
Class FSIteratorFactory

java.lang.Object
  fr.lipn.nlptools.uima.common.FSIteratorFactory

public class FSIteratorFactory
extends java.lang.Object

Library about manipulating FSIterator objets. Provides some convenient methods to handle annotations with the LIPN approach. In particular can create thread-safe iterators. See also ThreadSafeFSIterator

Author:
erwan

Method Detail

createFSIterator

public static org.apache.uima.cas.FSIterator<org.apache.uima.jcas.tcas.Annotation> createFSIterator(org.apache.uima.jcas.JCas aJCas,
                                                                                                    int type,
                                                                                                    org.apache.uima.jcas.tcas.Annotation subIteratorSource,
                                                                                                    boolean threadSafe,
                                                                                                    org.apache.uima.cas.FSMatchConstraint constraint)
Parameterized creation of an FSIterator object (possibly thread-safe)

Parameters:
aJCas - the CAS
type - the type of annotation (as obtained with myAnnot.type)
subIteratorSource - if not null, use this Annotation as the super-annotation for this iterator: in other words, creates a sub-iterator of this annotation.
threadSafe - if true, the resulting FSIterator is thread-safe (it can be used in different threads running in the same instance inside an AE)
constraint - if not null, an FSMatchConstraint which can be used to filter the annotations this iterator will return.
Returns:
the FSIterator

createWindowFSIterator

public static org.apache.uima.cas.FSIterator<org.apache.uima.jcas.tcas.Annotation> createWindowFSIterator(org.apache.uima.jcas.JCas aJCas,
                                                                                                          int type,
                                                                                                          boolean threadSafe,
                                                                                                          int windowStart,
                                                                                                          int windowEnd,
                                                                                                          boolean exactMatch)
Returns an iterator satisfying a "window" constraint, i.e. the condition for an annotation A is: A.getBegin() >= begin and end <= A.getEnd(). Notice that this is different from a sub-iterator: if using a sub-iterator in the case where two annotations A and B have the exact same position, the order which can be defined in the AE descriptor (see 'priority lists' in UIMA doc) determines whether A < B or A > B. That means that either a sub-iterator of A will not return B, or the converse. This method uses constraints in order to overcome this limitation of sub-iterators (but it is also less efficient).

Parameters:
aJCas - the CAS
type - the type
threadSafe - whether thread-safe or not
windowStart - start position
windowEnd - end position
exactMatch - if true, the condition becomes A.getBegin() == begin and end == A.getEnd()
Returns:
the FSIterator

createWindowConstraint

public static org.apache.uima.cas.FSMatchConstraint createWindowConstraint(org.apache.uima.jcas.JCas aJCas,
                                                                           int begin,
                                                                           int end,
                                                                           boolean exactMatch,
                                                                           boolean threadSafe)
Creates a "window" constraint, i.e. the condition for an annotation A is: A.getBegin() >= begin and end <= A.getEnd().

Parameters:
aJCas -
begin -
end -
exactMatch - if true, the condition becomes A.getBegin() == begin and end == A.getEnd()
threadSafe -
Returns:
the resulting constraint

createStringFeatureValueConstraint

public static org.apache.uima.cas.FSMatchConstraint createStringFeatureValueConstraint(org.apache.uima.jcas.JCas aJCas,
                                                                                       int type,
                                                                                       java.lang.String featureName,
                                                                                       java.lang.String value,
                                                                                       boolean threadSafe)
Creates a String filtering constraint using feature featureName: the annotation A must satisfy A.getFeatureName == value

Parameters:
aJCas -
type - the type on which constraints will be applied. Must have a featureName feature.
featureName - the feature name, which must be valid for the type.
value - the value that the feature must match.
threadSafe -
Returns:
the resulting constraint

                                                                                         int type,
                                                                                         boolean threadSafe)

createMultiStringConstraint

public static org.apache.uima.cas.FSMatchConstraint createMultiStringConstraint(org.apache.uima.jcas.JCas aJCas,
                                                                                int type,
                                                                                java.lang.String[] featureNames,
                                                                                java.lang.String[] featureValues,
                                                                                boolean threadSafe)
Creates a constraint such that the annotation A must satisfy A.getFeatureName == featureValue for all pairs (featureNames[i], featureValues[i]). The arrays must have the same size, and the annotation type must include all featuresNames.

Parameters:
featureNames - the list of features names to be compared
featureValues - the corresponding list of values
Returns:
the resulting constraint, or null if the arrays were empty
